record.dc:title: 413HA1 Dallas Site 8HA1, Hamilton County, Tennessee. Village. Feature 41, Structure, including fire basin.
record.wpa:narrative: Structure - sunk from St. II into subsoil. Square with rounded corners. Post holes along inside edge of sunken area. Floor sunk ca. 1.0' below St. II. The walls of the sunken area are clearly defined. No bench or other features. Fire basin round and deep - 1.6'. Pottery on floor was shell temper. Floor seemed to be marked by shell hoes, and covered with fine sand. [Added later to document]: Structure - Feature 41 - intrusive from St. II cleared. This is a deeply sunk semi-terranean structure - sunk about 1.0' - extends down into undisturbed basic clay. Structure is square, rounded corners. Post holes are large and small regularly alternating. Deep circular fire basin in center - had low unbaked curb.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution. See also photograph 412HA1 [fhm01134].
